detaileddescription.para: Type that is stored inside vector.
Number of individual values stored by object. This value can be used to iterate over elements.
Default constructor. Sets zero to whole vector.

Initializes vector with value from other vector.
init
Object which value will be copied.

Initializes vector but using __m256i type.
init
Raw value to be set.

Initialize vector with values read from an array.
init
Array from which values will be copied.

Initialize vector with values using pointer.
addr
A valid address containing at least 16 short numbers.
If
in debug mode and addr is nullptr throws std::invalid_argument. Otherwise no exception will be thrown.

Initializes all vector fields with single value.
b
A literal value to be set.

Loads data from memory into vector (memory should be of size of at least 32 bytes). Memory doesn't need to be aligned to any specific boundary. If sP is nullptr this method has no effect.
pSrc
Pointer to memory from which to load data.
std::invalid_argument
If in Debug mode and pSrc is nullptr. In Release builds this method never throws (for nullptr method will have no effect).

Saves data to destination in memory.
dest
Reference to the list to which vector will be saved. Array doesn't need to be aligned to any specific boundary.
Saves data to destination in memory. The memory doesn't have to be aligned to any specific boundary.

See https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/c/aligned_alloc for more details.
pDest
A valid pointer to a memory of at least 32 bytes (16x short).
std::invalid_argument
If in Debug mode and pDest is nullptr. In Release builds this method never throws (for nullptr method will have no effect).
Saves data to destination in memory. The memory must be aligned at 32-byte boundary.

See https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/c/aligned_alloc for more details.
pDest
A valid pointer to a memory of at least 32 bytes (16x short).
std::invalid_argument
If in Debug mode and pDest is nullptr. In Release builds this method never throws (for nullptr method will have no effect).

Get the internal vector value.
The value of __m256i vector.

Set the internal vector value.
value
New value to be set.

Indexing operator.
index
Position of desired element between 0 and 15.
Value of underlying element.
std::out_of_range
If index is not within the correct range.

Compares with second vector for equality.
bV
Object to compare.
true if all elements are equal or false if not.

Compares with value for equality.
b
Value to compare.
true if all elements are equal to passed value false if not.

Compares with second vector for inequality.
bV
Object to compare.
true if any alement is not equal to corresponding element in bV otherwise false.

Compares with value for inequality.
b
Value
true if any alement is not equal to corresponding element in bV otherwise false.
Performs an integer division.

NOTE: Value is first casted to int and then to float and inverse to return integer result which has not been yet tested for performance.
bV
Divisors vector.
Result of integer division with truncation.
Performs an integer division.

NOTE: Value is first casted to int and then to float and inverse to return integer result which has not been yet tested for performance.
bV
Divisor value.
Result of integer division with truncation.
Performs a modulo operation.

NOTE: Analogously as in / and /= operators values are casted before performing a division.
bV
Divisors vector.
Modulo result.
Performs a modulo operation.

NOTE: Analogously as in / and /= operators values are casted before performing a division.
bV
Divisor.
Modulo result.

Performs left bitwise shift of corresponding values.
bV
Second vector that specifies number of bits to shift (for each 16-bit value).
New value of v shifted by number of bits specfied in bV.
Class providing vectorized version of short. Can hold 16 individual short values. Provides arithmetic and bitwise operators. Provides comparison operators == !=.
